text: {| |} SS Corsea, a laden 2674-grt William Cory & Son collier in convoy FS 32 on 11 November 1940, by a Junkers Ju 87 Stuka bomber. There were no casualties, and the ship reached the Thames safely. Two other colliers in the same convoy ( and ) were bombed by the same Luftwaffe group at the same time.(Sources--Nat Archive files ADM 199/375, ADM 199/1601, Lloyd's Lists, HMSO Lists of Shipping Losses). ==References== Category:World War II merchant ships of the United Kingdom Category:Colliers Category:1921 ships Category:Merchant ships of Finland Category:Ships built on the River Wear Category:Maritime incidents in November 1940
title: SS Corsea
